dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Jim Cramer on Apple Inc (AAPL): ‘When You Say That There’s Been No Innovation Since Steve, I Find That Inflammatory’
News Content: We recently compiled a list of the Jim Cramer Discusses Joe Rogan, Elon Musk, And These 13 Stocks.In this article, we are going to take a look at where Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL) stands against the other stocks.

In one of his latest appearances on CNBC's Squawk on the Street, Jim Cramer started the morning by commenting on the latest Producer Price Index (PPI) release. The PPI, which tracks inflation upstream of the supply chain, rose by 0.2% in December and fell short of economist expectations of 0.3%. However, this didn't lead to any significant reaction in the bond market. According to Cramer, "Carl these, the bonds just don't want to react to anything good. Of course, we can immediately say, it's because we're gonna get a tough CPI number tomorrow. The fact is, is these numbers are tame. People have to start recognizing that there are some good numbers coming."

He shared other factors that might be fueling the bond market's performance. "House prices coming down, food coming down, but it doesn't seem to matter," Cramer remarked. He added "What the bonds are reacting to I think is a new administration, uh, concern about what is going to be, uh, tariffs, even though it looks like they're going to be phased in. You know David, interest rates don't wanna come down here. And they don't wanna come down there's too much issuance, there's a belief that the next administration is much more inflationary. And David it doesn't seem to matter what is printed, the bonds don't want to go higher. Interest rate's not low enough."

Another news that has made a lot of headlines recently is TikTok's fate in the US. Cramer believes that rather than a complete bank, there could "be a gradual diminution of the service. In other words, it's not going to be turned off. I think that this whole idea that the Chinese Communist Party is really just a gigantic private equity firm leaves me cold. I just don't think that they are in a situation to broker a deal."

One person that the CNBC TV show host believes isn't discussed enough is electric vehicle billionaire Elon Musk. "I mean, Carl, it's so exciting to talk about Elon Musk. I mean we haven't talked about Elon, you know you have to wait maybe to nine o' four to talk about Elon Musk. I just say we do it at the very top," believes Cramer. He added "We have Elon Musk being the most important, well, he's, he's co-president right now which I think is a little absurd.. . . this man has become, Carl, a nation-state within. He's a state within a state."

Story Continues

On the topic of markets, Cramer was appreciative of the fact that the market and equal-weighted benchmark S&P indexes are up identically over the last six months "Well look I, that's good news actually. We want to have broader leadership," he remarked. However, without Wall Street's favorite AI stock, Cramer believes "you have a market that's kind of ruthless. . . David, you know that this market survives on NASDAQ fuel and not on Dow fuel. And yet people still insist on talking about the Dow."

Finally, Cramer has also spent quite a bit of time discussing social media CEO Mark Zuckerberg's appearance on the Joe Rogan Experience podcast. This time around, he shared "I'll go right to Joe Rogan. I'll be five hours in Joe Rogan. One of the most jarring things about the Joe Rogan interview was that he said he had to take a bathroom break. Well, there's professionalism personified." Cramer also commented on whether 38% is too much for an interviewer to speak. Taking a mixed view, he stated "I think it is. I used to put a stopwatch to my show Kudlow & Cramer. I got to speak 38% of the time so you know what, maybe it's not so bad."

Our Methodology

To make our list of the stocks that Jim Cramer talked about, we listed down all the stocks he mentioned during CNBC’s Squawk on the Street aired yesterday.

For these stocks, we also mentioned the number of hedge fund investors. Why are we interested in the stocks that hedge funds invest in? The reason is simple: our research has shown that we can outperform the market by imitating the top stock picks of the best hedge funds. Our quarterly newsletter’s strategy selects 14 small-cap and large-cap stocks every quarter and has returned 275% since May 2014, beating its benchmark by 150 percentage points. (see more details here).Is Apple Inc. (AAPL) the Best Safe Dividend Stock for 2025?

A wide view of an Apple store, showing the range of products the company offers.

Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL)

Number of Hedge Fund Holders In Q3 2024: 158

Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL) is the most valuable consumer technology company in the world. The stock's performance in today's AI era has been mixed. Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL)'s shares were laggards ahead of the WWDC conference last year, but since the event, they added 29.81% through the year. In 2025, the shares are down by 4.3% year-to-date as investors wonder whether Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL) can push AI to consumers through its products and if the iPhone can sustain sales momentum. Cramer, for his part, shared his take on Mark Zuckerberg's comments that Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL)'s innovation has slowed:

"Well, I think when you say that there's been no innovation since Steve, Steve Jobs died, I don't know, I find that inflammatory. But you know what. . . .that was rough, I wanted to go to them and say could you please tell me, I wanted to call them on my Apple devices and use the 72 Apple devices I have [inaudible] and as well as the revenue stream, and talk about how we have now become integrated worldwide with Apple. But you know what let's just stick with Android."

Overall AAPL ranks 3rd on our list of the stocks Jim Cramer recently discussed. While we acknowledge the potential of AAPL as an investment, our conviction lies in the belief that some AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns and doing so within a shorter timeframe. If you are looking for an AI stock that is more promising than AAPL but that trades at less than 5 times its earnings, check out our report about the cheapest AI stock.

READ NEXT: 8 Best Wide Moat Stocks to Buy Now and 30 Most Important AI Stocks According to BlackRock.

Disclosure: None. This article is originally published at Insider Monkey.

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.75, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.25, Reasoning: The analysis indicates that Apple Inc. (AAPL) is managing its debt levels conservatively while showing strong cash flow and profitability. The company's low net debt to EBITDA ratio, high interest coverage, and the fact that it generates robust free cash flow further signal financial stability. Given these factors, the overall sentiment towards the company's debt management is positive, suggesting a higher likelihood of stock price appreciation rather than depreciation. Thus, the probabilities reflect a strong expectation for the stock price to rise.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news article suggests a potential shift in market focus away from the 'Magnificent Seven' stocks, including Apple, towards other opportunities within the S&P 500. Key points include: 1) Apple's stock is already down year-to-date (-8%); 2) The article highlights potentially faster earnings growth in the other 493 S&P 500 companies; 3) It also mentions that expectations for Mag 7 earnings growth are slowing; 4) Rising bond yields are negatively affecting the Mag 7; and 5) BlackRock is advocating for investments in quality and growth at a reasonable price, which suggests some investors might be seeking bargains outside the Mag 7. The overall tone is that Apple might underperform relative to other stocks. There is a slight positive note as the IT sector (where Apple is) is projected for double digit profit growth. Given the negative sentiment towards the Mag 7, combined with some double digit growth, a moderate probability of the stock price to fall is assigned with a roughly equivalent probability for a rise.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news headline 'Why Apple Stock Could Get Hammered This Year' is inherently bearish.  However, without the actual content of the article, a precise probability assessment is impossible.  The lack of specific information prevents a detailed analysis of the potential drivers behind a price drop.  Factors like the strength of Apple's product cycle, economic conditions, and competitive landscape are not considered.  Therefore, while the headline suggests a higher probability of a price fall, the absence of article content necessitates a cautious estimation.  A moderately bearish prediction is made based solely on the headline's negative sentiment.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news headline and content primarily discuss Jim Cramer's comments on Apple Inc. (AAPL), including his defense of Apple's innovation post-Steve Jobs and broader market commentary. While Cramer's remarks could be seen as supportive of Apple, the overall tone of the news is neutral, focusing more on general market trends and other topics like TikTok, Elon Musk, and Mark Zuckerberg. The article does not provide any significant new financial data or catalysts specific to Apple that would strongly influence its stock price. Given the mixed performance of Apple's stock recently (down 4.3% YTD in 2025) and the lack of concrete positive or negative news, the impact of this article on Apple's stock price is likely minimal. The probabilities are estimated based on the neutral nature of the news and the absence of strong directional signals.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article discusses Warren Buffett's stock picks, including Apple Inc. (AAPL). While the article mentions that Buffett and his lieutenants have been paring back the size of Berkshire's stake in Apple, it also notes that Berkshire's $70 billion stake in Apple is still its single biggest position. The article highlights Apple's potential for growth, particularly with its AI-powered tool and processor chip development. However, the recent stagnation in revenue and iPhone sales could be a concern. Overall, the article presents a neutral to positive view of Apple's prospects.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news article suggests that investors should consider buying the 493 other S&P 500 stocks instead of the 'Mag 7' stocks, which include Apple Inc. (AAPL). The article cites that the 'Mag 7' names are expected to grow earnings by 18% in 2025, a slowdown from the 25% pace in 2024, and that the 493 other stocks could post an 11% earnings growth this year. Additionally, the article mentions that the financials sector is expected to report the highest profit increase in the fourth quarter at 39.5%. Considering this information, it seems that the article is not very positive about the 'Mag 7' stocks, including Apple Inc. (AAPL), and is instead suggesting that investors look into other stocks. Therefore, the probability of the stock price of Apple Inc. (AAPL) rising due to this news is relatively low, while the probability of the stock price falling is relatively high.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.75, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.25, Reasoning: The financial news highlights Apple's prudent and conservative approach to leveraging debt. Apple has shown a minimal net debt load, strong cash reserves, and robust EBIT margins, which indicate a company in a strong financial position. These factors suggest that the company can comfortably manage its debt burden, leading to reduced financial risks and improved investor confidence.
Round: 1

This suggests the company is in a strong financial position, capable of meeting its obligations without significant risk. While there are some negative sentiments around the broader market performance of 'Magnificent Seven' stocks, Apple’s solid cash flow and profitability counterbalance these concerns. Therefore, despite some caution in the market, the overall financial health and performance of Apple suggest a stronger likelihood of stock price appreciation.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news article suggests a negative outlook for the 'Magnificent Seven' stocks, including Apple. The article highlights that these stocks might not be the best investment choice currently, with expectations of slower earnings growth compared to other S&P 500 stocks. Specifically, Apple is already down 8% year-to-date. While other models in Round 0 showed a mixed sentiment on Apple's outlook, there seems to be a consensus in general that the stock might underperform relative to the broader market indicated, leading to a slightly increased probability of a price decrease this time.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The headline "Why Apple Stock Could Get Hammered This Year" is inherently bearish, immediately suggesting a higher probability of a price drop.  However, the lack of article content prevents a definitive assessment. The previous predictions are mixed, with some models favoring a price rise (0.75 probability by gpt-4o-mini) based on Apple's strong financial position and others significantly favoring a price fall (0.7 probability by gemini-flash-1.5 and meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct) due to concerns about market shifts away from the 'Magnificent Seven' and slower earnings growth expectations.  The wide divergence highlights the uncertainty and suggests that the headline alone is insufficient for a strong prediction.  Considering the bearish headline and the range of previous predictions, I assign a moderately higher probability to a price fall, acknowledging significant uncertainty. The mixed opinions from prior models reflect the complex factors affecting Apple's stock.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news article primarily discusses Jim Cramer's comments on Apple Inc. (AAPL), including his defense of Apple's innovation post-Steve Jobs and broader market commentary. Considering prior models' predictions, there's a consistent trend of decreasing the probability of a stock price rise and increasing the probability of a stock price fall. This aligns with the overall narrative of the news article. Based on these points, the probability of a stock price fall is higher.

Others focus on the potential for underperformance compared to other S&P 500 companies, slower earnings growth expectations for the 'Magnificent Seven,' and a potential market shift away from these large-cap stocks, leading to predictions of a price fall.  The mixed signals, combined with a bearish headline, suggest a higher probability of a price fall, but not an overwhelming one. The analysis indicates that the overall positive outlook for Apple's core business and financial health should outweigh the broader market sentiments. However, the negative sentiments about the 'Magnificent Seven' stocks and the IT sector's growth being offset by broader market shifts introduce some uncertainty.
Round: 3

Despite its strong fundamentals, including low net debt ratios, high interest coverage, and robust cash flow generation, the broader market's attention appears to be shifting away from these major tech stocks towards potentially better-performing sectors. Moreover, the concerns regarding slower earnings growth predictions for the 'Magnificent Seven' stocks may create headwinds for Apple's stock price. Given the mixed sentiments reflected in previous models and the overall context from the news article, a cautious outlook leads to a balanced probability of price rise and fall.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.38, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.62, Reasoning: The news article suggests a shift in investor focus away from the 'Magnificent Seven' stocks, including Apple, toward other S&P 500 companies. Several factors contribute to this sentiment: Apple's stock is already down year-to-date, the article highlights potentially faster earnings growth in other S&P 500 companies, expectations for Mag 7 earnings growth are slowing, and rising bond yields negatively affect these stocks. While the IT sector, which includes Apple, is projected for double-digit profit growth, the overall tone leans towards underperformance of the Mag 7. The trend in previous predictions shows a decrease in the probability of a stock price rise and a corresponding increase in the probability of a stock price fall, further reinforcing this negative outlook. Therefore, I estimate a higher probability of the stock price falling for Apple.

The headline is bearish, suggesting a potential decline in Apple's stock price.  However, the content of the news is not fully provided, and the previous predictions show a significant divergence of opinion. Some models emphasize Apple's strong financial health (low debt, strong cash flow, high profitability), supporting a price rise. Others focus on macroeconomic factors, a potential shift away from 'Magnificent Seven' stocks, slower earnings growth compared to other S&P 500 companies, and rising bond yields, suggesting a higher probability of a price fall.  The lack of concrete information in the news itself makes a strong prediction difficult. Considering the mixed signals, the trend of bearish predictions in later rounds, and the inherent uncertainty due to the lack of article content, I lean towards a slightly higher probability of a price fall, but the overall uncertainty is high, resulting in probabilities closer to 0.5. My assessment incorporates the observed trend of decreasing prediction confidence in a stock price rise across several models over the rounds, suggesting a growing sentiment of uncertainty/negativity.

"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]",

"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.
